name: Sunflower
description: Tall, vibrant flower with a large central disk surrounded by bright yellow petals. Symbolizes adoration, loyalty, and longevity.
uses: Decorative purposes, oil extraction, bird feed.
cultivation: Annual plant that thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight. Tolerant of dry conditions but benefits from regular watering.
details: Comes in various sizes and varieties, including dwarf types. Flowers can range from small to extremely large.
instructions: Plant seeds directly in the ground after the last frost date. Provide support for tall varieties. Deadhead spent blooms to encourage continuous flowering.
water: Regular watering, particularly during dry spells. Avoid overwatering to prevent root rot.
solutions: Good air circulation, avoid overhead watering, remove infected plant parts.
fertilizers: Balanced fertilizer at planting, top-dress with compost during the growing season.

name: Rose
description: Perennial shrub with fragrant flowers in a wide range of colors. Symbolizes love, beauty, and passion.
cultivation: Prefers well-drained soil and full sunlight. Regular watering is essential, particularly during dry spells.
details: Comes in various sizes and forms, including shrubs, climbers, and groundcovers. Flowers can be single or double, with different petal arrangements.
instructions: Plant in well-drained soil with good air circulation. Prune regularly to maintain shape and encourage new growth. Deadhead spent blooms to encourage continuous flowering.
water: Regular watering, particularly during dry spells. Avoid overhead watering to prevent fungal diseases.
solutions: Good air circulation, avoid overhead watering, remove infected plant parts.
fertilizers: Balanced fertilizer at planting, top-dress with compost during the growing season.

name: Lavender
description: Perennial herb with fragrant flowers in shades of purple. Symbolizes calmness, relaxation, and healing.
cultivation: Thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight. Tolerant of dry conditions but benefits from regular watering.
details: Comes in various sizes and varieties, including dwarf types. Flowers can range from light to dark purple.
instructions: Plant in well-drained soil with good air circulation. Prune regularly to maintain shape and encourage new growth. Deadhead spent blooms to encourage continuous flowering.
water: Regular watering, particularly during dry spells. Avoid overwatering to prevent root rot.
solutions: Avoid overwatering, provide good drainage, avoid overhead watering.
fertilizers: Avoid excessive fertilization, top-dress with compost during the growing season.

name: Tulip
description: Perennial bulbous plant with cup-shaped flowers in a wide range of colors. Symbolizes perfect love and beauty.
cultivation: Plant bulbs in well-drained soil in the fall for spring blooms. Prefers full sunlight and regular watering.
details: Comes in various sizes and forms, including single and double blooms. Flowers can be solid or bi-colored.
instructions: Plant bulbs in well-drained soil with the pointed end facing up. Water after planting and provide mulch for winter protection. Deadhead spent blooms to encourage continuous flowering.
water: Regular watering, particularly during dry spells. Avoid overwatering to prevent bulb rot.
solutions: Avoid overhead watering, remove infected plant parts, plant disease-resistant varieties.
fertilizers: Balanced fertilizer at planting, top-dress with compost during the growing season.

name: Daisy
description: Perennial flower with white petals and a yellow center. Symbolizes innocence, purity, and new beginnings.
cultivation: Thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight. Tolerant of dry conditions but benefits from regular watering.
details: Comes in various sizes and varieties, including single and double blooms. Flowers can be solid or bi-colored.
instructions: Plant in well-drained soil with good air circulation. Deadhead spent blooms to encourage continuous flowering.
water: Regular watering, particularly during dry spells. Avoid overwatering to prevent root rot.
diseases: Powdery mildew, leaf spot, crown rot.
solutions: Good air circulation, avoid overhead watering, remove infected plant parts.
fertilizers: Balanced fertilizer at planting, top-dress with compost during the growing season.

name: Orchid
description: Perennial flowering plant with exotic blooms in a wide range of colors. Symbolizes love, beauty, and luxury.
cultivation: Requires well-drained soil and indirect sunlight. Water sparingly and avoid overwatering.
details: Comes in various sizes and forms, including epiphytic and terrestrial varieties. Flowers can be single or double, with different petal arrangements.
instructions: Plant in well-drained soil with good air circulation. Water sparingly and avoid overwatering. Provide support for climbing varieties.
water: Water sparingly, allowing the soil to dry out between waterings. Avoid overwatering to prevent root rot.
solutions: Avoid overwatering, provide good drainage, avoid overhead watering.
fertilizers: Avoid excessive fertilization, top-dress with compost during the growing season.
